sen.j: 成田 達志（なりた たつし、1964年 -）は小鼓方幸流の能楽師。
sen.e: Tatsushi NARITA (1964-) is a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) of Kotsuzumi kata of Ko school.
Tatsushi NARITA (1964-) is a Noh actor who plays kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum player) in the Ko school.
sen.cmt: Nohgakushi (Noh actor)→Noh actor、of Kotsuzumi kata of Ko school→who plays kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum player) in the Ko schoolとしました。
sen.e: Tatsushi NARITA (1964-) is a Noh actor who plays kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum player) in the Ko school.

sen.j: 曽和博朗（能楽師・小鼓方幸流・人間国宝）および曽和正博（能楽師・小鼓方幸流）に師事。
sen.e: Studied under Hiroshi SOWA (Nohgakushi of Kotsuzumi kata of Ko school, Living National Treasure) and Masahiro SOWA (Nohgakushi of Kotsuzumi kata of Ko school).
He studied under Hiroshi SOWA (Noh actor of the Ko school of kotsuzumi-kata, Living National Treasure) and Masahiro SOWA (Noh actor of the Ko school of kotsuzumi-kata).
sen.cmt: Studied→He studied、Nohgakushi→Noh actor、Kotsuzumi kata of Ko school→the Ko school of kotsuzumi-kataとしました。
sen.e: He studied under Hiroshi SOWA (Noh actor of the Ko school of kotsuzumi-kata, Living National Treasure) and Masahiro SOWA (Noh actor of the Ko school of kotsuzumi-kata).

sen.j: 1988年より清水晧祐（小鼓方大倉流）・山本哲也 (能楽師)（大鼓方大倉流）・守家由訓（大鼓方観世流）・中田弘美（太鼓方金春流）ら、大阪の能楽師囃子方の同世代と共に能楽グループ『響』を結成（～2002年）。
sen.e: Since 1988 to 2002, he established "Hibiki," a Noh actors group with Nohgaku hayashikata (the accompanists of Noh play) of the same generation in Osaka, including Kosuke SHIMIZU (Kotsuzumi kata Okura ryu (the Okura school of small hand drum in Noh play)), Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Nohgakushi)(Otsuzumi kata Okura ryu (the Okura school of large hand drum in Noh play)), Yoshinori MORIYA (Otsuzumi kata Kanze ryu (the Kanze school of large hand drum in Noh play)), and Hiromi NAKATA (Otsuzumi kata Konparu ryu (the Konparu school of stick drums in Noh play).

Since 1988 to 2002, he established "Hibiki," a group of Noh actors with Nohgaku hayashikata (the accompanists of Noh play) of the same generation in Osaka, including Kosuke SHIMIZU (the Okura school of kotsuzumi-kata), Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Noh actor) (the Okura school of otsuzumi-kata [large hand drum player]), Yoshinori MORIYA (the Kanze school of otsuzumi-kata), and Hiromi NAKATA (the Konparu school of taiko-kata [stick drum player]).
sen.cmt: a Noh actors group→a group of Noh actors、Nohgakushi→Noh actorとし、スペース追加、「小鼓方大倉流」「大鼓方大倉流」「大鼓方観世流」「太鼓方金春流」の表記を修正
sen.e: Since 1988 to 2002, he established "Hibiki," a group of Noh actors with Nohgaku hayashikata (the accompanists of Noh play) of the same generation in Osaka, including Kosuke SHIMIZU (the Okura school of kotsuzumi-kata), Tetsuya YAMAMOTO (Noh actor) (the Okura school of otsuzumi-kata [large hand drum player]), Yoshinori MORIYA (the Kanze school of otsuzumi-kata), and Hiromi NAKATA (the Konparu school of taiko-kata [stick drum player]).

sen.j: 2002年より山本哲也とともに、能楽ユニット「TTR能プロジェクト」結成、能楽堂にとらわれないライブ能など意欲的な舞台を作る。
sen.e: Since 2002, he formed a Nohgaku unit 'TTR Noh Project' with Tetsuya Yamamoto, and actively creates performances such as live-style Noh, at places other than Noh Theatres.
Since 2002, he formed a Nohgaku unit 'TTR Noh Project' with Tetsuya YAMAMOTO, and actively creates performances such as live-style Noh, at places other than Noh Theatres.
Since 2002, he formed a Nohgaku unit 'TTR Noh Project' with Tetsuya YAMAMOTO, and actively creates performances such as live-style Noh, at places other than Noh Theatres.

sen.j: TTRは達志のT、哲也のT、RevolutionのRから名づけられたという。
sen.e: TTR stands for Tatsushi, Tetsuya, and Revolution.
TTR stands for Tatsushi, Tetsuya, and Revolution.
TTR stands for Tatsushi, Tetsuya, and Revolution.

sen.j: 関西を中心に活動するが、東京ほか全国から望まれて出演する実力派。
sen.e: Being a great actor, he mainly performs in the Kansai area, but also performs across the country including Tokyo.
Being a great actor, he mainly performs in the Kansai area, but also performs across the country including Tokyo.
Being a great actor, he mainly performs in the Kansai area, but also performs across the country including Tokyo.

sen.j: 能の家の出身ではないが、弟の谷口有辞（本名・成田有辞）も大鼓方石井流の能楽師。
sen.e: Although he is not from the Noh family, but his younger brother Yuji TANIGUCHI (real name: Yuji NARITA) is a Nohgakushi of Otsuzumi kata of Ishii school.
Although he is not from the Noh family, but his younger brother Yuji TANIGUCHI (real name: Yuji NARITA) is also a Noh actor who plays otsuzumi-kata in the Ishii school.
sen.cmt: also追加、a Nohgakushi of Otsuzumi kata of Ishii school→a Noh actor who plays otsuzumi-kata in the Ishii schoolとしました。
sen.e: Although he is not from the Noh family, but his younger brother Yuji TANIGUCHI (real name: Yuji NARITA) is also a Noh actor who plays otsuzumi-kata in the Ishii school.
His father is a French national.
His father is a French national.
His father became a French national.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて修正しました。

sen.e: He called his father being a "French person."
He called his father being a 'French person.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: He called his father being a 'French person.'
